channel.title: Good / Evil
channel.description:
So, what are your ideas on good people and evil people?
does one evil act brand you as an evil person for life? or vise versa, one good act brand you good for life?
Can a serial killer sacrifice himself to save a child, and in your eyes, would that redeem him?
I see myself as a good person. in the past Ive lied, i cheated and ive i stolen But i stand up for people, i have saved countless puppies and kittens when i volunteered at an animal refuge. I would push a child out of the way of traffic and get hit myself. I donate money when i can. I see a girl getting hit by her boyfriend then i will step in.
So, i consider myself to be a good person. My good deeds define who i am to myself. What i am, and what i strive to be. in my mind, the ends justifys the means. Every bad deed i have done has been either preparing for, or lead to, a good one.
so back to the main point. Is someone truly good or evil? Can good dead cancel out a lifetime of bad ones? etc

item.title: Good / Evil
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

Good and evil do exist and are very real things … but you have to reach a certain level before you realize this. I’m still trying to sort it out right now. The most important thing I can say, is that doing “Good deeds” like donating to charity, helping people in trouble, etc. do not make you “Good”. For starters, you can be “good” by improving yourself, not just helping others. Good is very much a mindset; being able to look around at the universe around you and being able to see the wonder and mystery in everything that exists. Evil is looking around at the universe and only seeing what you deem to be important. Think about this, for example: Everything around you (Literally around you right at this moment, in the same room you are) has a history. At some point it was created, and somehow it has managed to arrive where it is today. Who knows where it has been, what it’s experienced? In this respect, things like giving to charity are entirely superficial IMO. If you really cared about the people/things that are supposedly benefiting from your donation, you would be out there doing it. You would be seeing it first hand, and you wouldn’t be doing it because “It’s the right thing to do”, you would be doing it because you have found the fascination in these things.

humans naturally only see what is important to them in the surrounding area, thats not an evil deed. Only seeing what you can manipulate to make your own life easier is evil. Good is simply just going that extra mile, you are toeing the line and also doing extra to make a difference. You might care so much about those people you are donating to, but there might be some reason you cant go and help them first hand. If you were donating to africa you cant just take a month off work to go and help them as your life would suffer and then the donations, from you to them, would cease. Meaning you are probably doing more damage by going there. Yeah while you’re there you might help the odd person but it wont be as simple as it sounds. Good is simply doing something to help someone else end of story.
